headline: Crispy Pork Cutlets
description: Golden crisp pork cutlets are served with Chef John's delicious cream gravy that's flavored with pickles, jalapeño pepper, and green onions.

video.description: See what happens when German schnitzel meets Southern country cooking.
video.name: Crispy Pork Cutlets

name: Crispy Pork Cutlets
recipeIngredient: 2 (1 1/4 pound) fully trimmed pork tenderloins, cut into 8 pieces
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or as needed
1 bunch green onions, chopped, green tops reserved
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste
1.5 cups cold milk, or more as needed
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce, or to taste
0.25 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Place pork pieces between two sheets of heavy plastic (resealable freezer bags work well) on a solid, level surface. Firmly pound pork with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a thickness of 1/2 inch.
Transfer pork pieces to a plate and season both sides generously with salt and black pepper; sprinkle with 2 tablespoons of flour, lightly coating both sides. Pour eggs over pork, turning to coat.
Place panko in a shallow bowl; place pork pieces in panko, pressing firmly to coat on both sides. Transfer breaded cutlets to a clean plate, cover with plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Stir in pickles, jalapeño pepper, and green onions; cook and stir until onions have softened, about 3 minutes. Sprinkle in 1 1/2 tablespoons flour; cook and stir for 3 minutes.

Slowly stir in 2 to 3 tablespoons cold milk, whisking constantly. Stir in remaining milk, Worcestershire sauce, and black pepper. Simmer on low for 5 minutes. Taste and adjust seasoning; set sauce aside.

Heat 1/4 cup vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1/2 of the breaded pork cutlets and cook until pork is no longer pink inside, and the crust is well-browned, 4 to 5 minutes per side.
Transfer to plate lined with paper towels. Sprinkle with salt. Repeat with remaining vegetable oil and pork cutlets.

review.reviewBody: These turned out great. The sauce was excellent. My cutlets may have been smaller than they were supposed to be. I only used one tenderloin and cut it into 8 slices. I think maybe it should have been 4. But oh well...

I have been making this recipe for years. I keep it as a special meal and invite the whole family. I use pork chops instead of the loin, but everything else the same. if your sauce isn't right, you did something wrong. I have to triple the sauce recipe,because we use it on our chops and butter noodles.
My husband and I loved this recipe and will definitely be making it again. I used jared jalapeños since I didn't have a fresh one and it was very good anyway.
It wus soooooooooooooooooooooooooo good
Beautiful recipe. I didn’t change a thing, and my husband thought it was great. I thought while making it he would think the pickles weren’t good in the gravy, but it was very good.
Easy to make and very tasty! Chef John, love your videos. You make everything easy to follow!
The pork was very good, nice and crispy, but I did not care for the sauce, it just did not compliment the dish at all.

Oh Chef John, you are my hero! This was delicious, of course. Can you do no wrong? The only change I made was use white onions in the gravy as I did not have any green and it was still great. I forgot the Worcestershire sauce but no matter. I boiled some baby potatoes and poured the sauce over that too. Added some steamed spinach on the side. I am so glad I made two so I can have one tomorrow as well. I'll be dreaming of that crispy cutlet tonight.

Love the sauce. The jalapeños give it an awesome flavour without really any heat. The other review that left out the jalapeños and pickles seems misguided, since otherwise your “gravy” is just milk. I don’t like pork though and so I’m on the search for something else to put this gravy on since the gravy is delicious.
Theses are a favorite, I make often. Don’t let the pickle scare yiu!
I’ve made this several times and it is fantastic, especially the jalapeño gravy…..YUM!!!

Absolutely scrumptious. I made it as written except had to sub the fresh jalapenos for tamed pickled jalapenos. We absolutely loved everything about this dish and today we're having cutlet sandwiches.

To die for. My family says this goes in the rotation, and they kept talking about what else we’d use this gravy on. 

Only changes: cooked the pork first, emptied the pan of fat, then proceeded with the gravy. No need to dirty another pan. And we left out the pickles. Sorry pickles. And didn’t have panko, so plain bread crumbs were used. 

I don’t know why or how but the pork got as crispy and gorgeous as anything I’ve ever pan fried. It was perfection.
Mine did not come out very crispy but did taste good , I didn't make the thought it would take too long.
I just made it and my husband and I give it thumbs up. I am pleasantly pleased. Followed the recipe except the jalapeños. I will make this again.

This was delicious! I was intrigued by the dill pickle/jalapeño gravy. I would use the frying technique for other meats. The only change I made was I used dill pickle relish (1/4 cup) because I didn't have any dill pickles. We ended up having this two nights in a row!
Excellent!

I used seasoned planko crumbs . I used suggestions from reviews & added seasoning to the sauce but still wasn’t convinced so I added a couple teaspoons of instant chicken soup granules. That kicked it up. My DH saved a forkful of sauce for his last bite of the meal! Thank you for something new as I was going to just make white gravy until I saw this recipe.

Well, I tried to review and hit save by accident. I left the w sauce out of the roux because I didn’t have any. I added garlic powder towards the end. The pickles made it incredible. My husband and daughter loved this too!! So yummy!!! ?

I had no spring onions, just diced sweet onion and sauted it- made the sauce 'lumpy' but was delicious, I also trimmed the chops and rendered it along with a few pieces of bacon in the oil used for frying the cutlets, added a lot of flavor

At first we weren’t too sure about pickles, jalapeños, and green onions in a gravy, but with everything going on with COVID we have made an effort to start trying new recipes in our family because let’s be serious, the same old recipes are getting a little boring. Boy are we glad we tried this one! Everyone in our family loved it.... including our super picky 12-year-old. All three of our children already asked if we can add this one as a meal we cook regularly. The gravy tastes a little weird on its own, but when you put it on the pork cutlets (and mashed potatoes like we did) it transforms into something truly unique and delicious. Two thumbs way up!
This is fantastic and easy to make. Just the right amount of spice.
I dipped the cutlets in the flour, egg and breadcrumbs for a more even coating. The cutlets were great. Served it with Mashed Potato Pancakes (recipe from AllRecipes), brown gravy and applesauce.

This delicious dish is simple and the flavors come together in this sauce so gracefully with the pork loin cutlet ,I don’t usually cook in oil but I started my first cutlet in butter in a non stick skillet that was somewhat uneven from just being old and well used ,and the color and cook temp was uneven on the cutlet ,so I used my good kitchen aid skillet with little canola and fried them med heat and turned out just like the picture ,I’m in love with this simple recipe !!!

Made this for 8 last night. It was delicious. After reading some of the reviews I did make some changes. the pork was pork cutlet. Along with the salt and pepper the pork was also seasoned with granulated onion, garlic and a pinch of cayenne pepper. Substituted Wickles pickles for the dill (it's what I had). This was being served with smashed red potatoes, so I quadrupled the gravy (along with the scallions and jalapeño). After tasting the gravy added a splash more of Worcestershire sauce to offset the pickles

While I usually love Chef John..this recipe was lacking. So much that I've had this account somewhere in the area of early 2000s that I am leaving my first review. I felt the gravy for this had too much milk and thus made it bland. I added in some pickle juice, garlic, doubled the Worcestershire sauce and salt and it was better but nothing to write home about. The lack of seasoning on the actual pork chops themselves was sad so I added in garlic to the mix. My modifications (though small) improved the recipe but I hate following a recipe only to change it. If you do decide to make this...taste before things are done (within reason, don't go for raw pork now) and make it to your own liking. I felt overall it lacked seasoning.
Delicious! I used boneless pork chops coated in egg and crushed pork rinds, then substituted whipping cream and no flour for the sauce to make it keto.
This was great! I made one modification and used green pepper instead of the jalapeño and it was very tasty. Family loved it. Thank you Chef John!
This was good. I love Panko breaded cutlets and the dill, Jalapeño roux is a nice touch. Definitely a keeper recipe and I will make this again
No, followed this great recipe exactly. Family raves about it. The pickle cream sauce is a huge hit, and perfect foil for the breading and deep frying. Next time will add the celeriac puree, as well.
This fancy tarter sauce is surprisingly better than the original. Excellent hangover cure! I will make it again!
A bit more seasoning would help... next time.

This turned out great! I was skeptical about the pickles but wow they were perfect. My very picky family all loved it! I will definitely make again. I didn’t have a jalapeño so I used chili powder and it gave a great kick.
very good . pleasantly different &tasty
The pork was great, the sauce was weird with pickles.

LOVE THIS RECIPE!! I did as another contributor did, and sliced the loin thinly and did not pound it. This was easy, SUPER tasty, and perfect for a week night when there isn't a lot of meal prep time to spare. I used a Tzatziki sauce with my cutlets, as that's what I had on hand, and it was delicious! Thank you for this!
Really good and easy to make
Good and tasty, which my company loved it. I will make it again. Thanks

Delicious. Pork cutlet was crispy and very tender. I used pork cutlets already pounded (like a cube steak). Definitely good to prepare ahead of time and put in the fridge. 
Sauce was a surprise. I wasn’t sure I would like the combination but it was great!
LOVED THIS RECIPE THE SAUCE WAS AMAZING ON TOP OF THE COOKED PORK, SERVED STEAMED BROCCOLI WITH
Just simple and easy, even my 2 years old asked for more. This cutlets are the best. Defiantly a keeper.
Mmm, really loved it and will make again.
just had more pork loin pieces to cook

I made it exactly as written and was very pleased with how crispy the cutlets were as well
 As the flavor of the sauce, never would have thought I’d like dill pickles in a gravy!
Sauce was just not "my cup of tea"; however, I watched the video before I prepared the pork cutlets and it is now my preferred way to bread meat. Efficient and economical.
My family loved this recipe! Nice balance on the sauce. Definitely will be making it again!
Made it with chicken...delicious!

We loved this recipe, especially my husband. I did not have jalapenos so I added a squirt of dijon mustard as suggested by another reviewer. my only complaint is that it required a lot of last minute cooking, the sauce, frying the pork and cooking potatoes and baby broccoli. Next time I will simplify the veg so I don't feel hot and bothered by the time I sit down!

This recipe was fantastic. Hubby really liked it. The sauce was different since it had dill pickles in it, don't be scared. It was delicious. Perfect for the cutlets. Definitely going to be making this again. I also appreciated the instructions on preparing the cutlets. Letting them sit in the frig once breaded was helpful and the breading stayed on the cutlet.

I made the full recipe of the sauce and only 2 pork cutlets and served it over pasta. The jalapeno I used was huge. I was expecting some zing. The sauce was just ok. It was amazingly bland. Not for me.
we liked it. The gravy is the star here. very unique but we all loved it (even my 2 and 4 year old kids). it's not spicy at all even with the jalapeno in there

I made this for dinner last night it was a hit , so easy to follow this meal made it to my dinner list. I have a dinner list for my family to pick from and not all recipes make it that far; I will be making this again
Turned out great. Thanks for the great dinner.
Easy Peasy.

We thought this was a delicious dinner! I ran out of panko crumbs and so used saltines and also subbed pepperoncinis instead of the jalapeno. I would have a little extra milk on hand to get the sauce the consistency you'd like, but this was an easy and tasty dinner! Thanks once again, Chef!
Used a deep fryer, but still fantastic. Spice up the meat before breading with cayenne and white pepper before breading
Family really liked it. Wasn't quite spicy enough for us though. Will use diced green chili in lieu of Jalapeno next time.
I just followed recipe for the breaded pork tenderloin. Needed to cook twice as long as indicated but delicious

We dug in before we had a chance to snap a picture. It is an usual combination of sauce ingredients . I’ll add more jalapeño for heat next time since half was not enough. My husband loved this recipe. We will make it again....and again.

my husband hates pork chops! I made this recipe tonight following directions exactly. and he went back for a second chop! even my 15 year old ate it. it was very good! it was not spicey at all..I was worried about the jalapeno. I think I may add a little something more for a kick next time. but this was a great change for dinner.
Simple and delicious
I did not have green onion. I added a little bacon grease and bacon bit to gravy and was surprised how good it was. I would prefer no Jalapeno in the future.

I was looking for a different type of pork tenderloin recipe. When I saw it was Chef John's I knew it would be good! It was a little time intensive with all the breading and frying, but it was worth it! The only thing I changed was due to not having the ingredient. I used a half of a dehydrated habanaro pepper in the gravy, (then picked out the pieces after) and also a teaspoon of A1 Steak Sauce since I didn't have Worcestershire sauce. I really liked the "zing" of the sauce with the pickles in there and the spice. I'd make it again. My mouth is still tingling from the pepper, but at least it wasn't a boring dinner. Served with rice and broccali.
stuck with the cutlets only and they were delicious. maybe next time i will be brave enough to try the gravy also.
At first I was worried about the dill gravy but it came out great and completed the meal. Will definitely cook agak.

I oh, so loved this recipe! I have to add, I also love the fact that my husband HATES onions, pickles for the most part, and jalapenos. But this is my year, 2018, I'm tired of cooking boring foods for the past two years of marriage. (Who came up with this institution? But that's another discussion.) An entire bunch of green onions, he didn't have a clue to any of the ingredients and LOVED this gravy. He did ask what the green stuff was (lol, everything) and I mumbled nothingness, and I'm pretty sure I heard him say the word "hide" to which I said nothing. I love to laugh. Even if it's on the inside! Will be making this often, and yes, with chicken, etc, and I think it would be great with Cod. Thank you John! What a kick! In more ways than one! Delicious!
Unreal good. Nice recipe. Will make it again. Family loved it. The sauce complimented the cutlets very well.
Really good! The pickle/jalapeno gravy is crazy good! I didn't remember printing the recipe and then looking at the ingredients, I wasn't sure why I did. Husband loved it.
Delicious! Thought I added to much green onion but found you can't add too much green onion!

These cutlets were divine. I was a little skeptical of the sauce because it sounded a little different but took the plunge and gave it a try. I forgot to buy green onions so I had to substitute red but the sauce was still good. My family raved about this meal.
so good!
Delicious! I didn't have pickles, so I chopped up pickled jalapenos and added some of the juice to the gravy to give it a little kick.
Garden was short on Jalipinos so I used a Haberino pepper. Just right! Really nice flavor with the pickle roo.

My 11 year old grandson is Celiac, so I adjusted the breading accordingly. I was worried he would not like the sauce (I used 1 tablespoon cornstarch) with the dill pickle, jalipeno pepper and onion etc. He devoured it and had seconds!! It was a hit with the whole family!!
Made country gravy for this recipe. Did not believe we would like the sauce with dill pickles and jalapeno. Otherwise made the pork as directed. Turned out great.
yes if u ever had the breading come off when frying try this I was amazed this works with anything pork cutlets or cube steaks I final seen what the trick was.... thanku so much
Best cutlet method for crispy succulent goodness. Will use it for chicken, etc. The sauce was exceptional and will also look for other uses.

Made it several times and the family loves it. I was at first hesitant on the pickels in the gravy but gave it a good taste with a little crunch. I tried this idea in other gravy used in other recipes.

Very tasty, even my picky 5-year-old granddaughter liked them. Dill pickles in the gravy is something that I would never have tried, they add flavor and a bit of crunch. Since I was cooking for tender tastebuds I substituted red bell pepper for the jalapeno, next time I make it I will do it with the extra spice. I highly recommend, watching the video, there are a few subtle things that have changed the way I handle the flour/egg/breading steps.

I used coconut oil, which is awesome for browning and crispness! Better for you than vegetable or canola oil! The sauce was amazing, didn't omit anything, I did use unsweetened almond milk, instead of dairy milk! Definitely, will make again!

Made as directed except for the jalapeño. We don't eat those. I almost didn't add pickles but everyone else said it was good so went with their recommendations. Excellent meal. I served it with mashed potatoes and creamed corn. Hubby says give it 5 stars and make it again. He almost didn't try the gravy because of the pickles, but he tried it on a little corner of the cutlet, then on most of the rest. Left a little corner for A1 because that's how he usually eats it. Thank you for a great recipe

This was delicious! The crispy texture was great, and the gravy a surprising combo of ingredients that worked together really well! I was worried that it might be too spicy for my kids, but it wasn't that spicy at all! The only change I made was adding a bit of garlic powder to the pork and to the gravy mixture.
I will definitely make this again!! Loved it and so did my family!
A big hit! everyone raved about the tenderness and the crunchyness!

I made the pork cutlets without the sauce and they were excellent. My husband said he liked the pork this. Very crispy. Next time I may add seasoning salt or garlic for some extra flavor, but excellent as is.
Very good. Everyone loved it! I would double the sauce the next time.

First time I made this, I had never had successful gravy. It came out perfectly! The cutlets are tender, the gravy devine! This has become my family's new favorite meal. Example: Both boys had already had dinner Wednesday night. I made this for my wife and myself but cooked two extra cutlets for the next day's lunches. The boys smelled the cutlets and gravy cooking and asked if they could have some as well. No cutlets for lunch, but won the nickle bet with my wife. Really, the sauce is the maker for this dish and teaches everyone how easy it can be to make a delicious gravy. Panko crumbs are not necessary, regular ones work fine, but the Panko adds extra crunch.

If I change it, I did not really make this recipe. The pickle and jalapeño gravy seemed like a strange combination to me, but gives a subtle, delicious, and different taste. My husband can be picky about pork dishes, but he requested it again. So easy and fast to produce an unique dish.

Delicious! I followed the recipe as written except I breaded using separate dishes, which is what I've been doing for years (old habits are hard to break I guess). The sauce is surprisingly yum. Don't be scared to try the pickles everyone! 
Thanks Chef John.

I was skeptical as other readers, about pickles in a white sauce,but both my husband and I really enjoyed this. I did not put jalepeno in, because we are not fans - but added the cayenne and it was still delish. Simple, tasty and quick for a weeknight supper.
Made this exactly as the recipe says and it was very good. We all really enjoyed the sauce.

My only complaint with this recipe is: I followed it exactly, portions, etc., and made it for the three of us. I only got one serving! There was nothing left - no sauce, no cutlets! Nuthin'! ;-)

This will definitely be made again.

If you make just the pork cutlet we gave it 5 stars. The meat was juicy & crispy. We won't make the sauce though cause my hubby couldn't eat it & I had just a little. Nasty. The instructions weren't complete as it lists cayenne pepper but never says where to add it.
This was A very easy recipe to fix. I would chop the pickles very fine next time.. My husband who does not like spicy stuff thought the sauce was good with the cutlets .
This was so delicious !!! We loved it, kids too. Looking forward to making it again.
Omg! Hands down the best !!! I just love the sauce . The whole mix of ingredients te very unique but absolutely delicious!
I skipped the pickles, too, but the basics of the recipe turned out a delicious dinner.
The pork was very moist. Excellent recipe!!

I dislike giving this only three stars as I thought it deserved a four. Four means that I will make this again, but my husband said it wasn't his cup,of tea - phooey! So although I gave this a three I think others should try this!
